Hi all, '0110100001100010' this is hb (happy birthday)

So, in 2012 I started to learn asm but nowadays I remember nothing :p

One thing I did was translate birth dates to binary in almost 25 seconds in mind (yup, I have witnesses). Ok is not a great deal :/ But now to try to consolidate a bit more ( maybe more months ) i decide to try to push some asm code just to feel like 'I did something with assembly' (is a shit, but I did it!)

Then basically we have to get one date (or whatever) as input and print the output as binary using assembly language for x86_64 arch

It's not my focus to be an asm programmer (maybe)
